Authors: Adinugroho T.Y., Heriyanni E., Musthofa T.A.S.
Title: Mobile web application for students’ and lecturers’ portfolio gallery
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adinugroho, T.Y., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia; Heriyanni, E., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia; Musthofa, T.A.S., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia
Abstract: Purpose: The purpose of this paper is to curate and promote students’ and lecturers’ works and creations, and to provide pleasing user experience for mobile device users when browsing the portfolio gallery information. Design/methodology/approach: The design of the mobile web application using Rational Unified Process (RUP) methodology includes Unified Modeling Language (UML) diagrams. The evaluation is done in three steps: first step by comparing similar software, the second step by evaluate the interface using the eight golden rules and the last one by taking user questionnaire. Findings: Evaluation of the application of Bina Nusantara University (BINUS) Store Mobile Web. Originality/value: The authors report the development of BINUS Store Mobile web application by using Hypertext Preprocessor (PHP) with Laravel framework and evaluate it in Android and iOS environments. © 2017, © Emerald Publishing Limited.
References: Bogossian, F.E., Kellett, S.E., Mason, B., The use of tablet PCs to access an electronic portfolio in the clinical setting: a pilot study using undergraduate nursing students (2008) Elsevier, pp. 246-253; Herrera, O., Ochoa, S.F., Neyem, A., Betti, M., Aldunate, R., Fuller, D.A., A mobile portfolio to support communities of practice in science education (2007) Online Communities and Social Computer, pp. 416-425. , Springer-Verlag, Berlin, Heidelberg; Huang, L., Lu, X., Ba, S., An empirical study of the cross-channe; effects between web and mobile shopping channels (2015) Information & Management; Hung, W.-H., ChanLin, L.-J., Development of mobile web for the library (2015) Procedia … Social and Behavioral Sciences, 197, pp. 259-264; Lee, G., Raghu, T.S., (2011) Product portfolio and mobile apps success: evidence from app store market, pp. 1-10. , Proceedings of the Seventeenth Americas Conference on Information Systems, Association for Information Systems, Detroit, MI; Ma, Y., Liu, X., Zhang, S., Xiang, R., Liu, Y., Xie, T., (2015) Measurement and analysis of mobile web cache performance, pp. 691-701. , Proceedings of the 24th International Conference on World Wide Web, ACM, New York, NY; Serrano, N., Hernantes, J., Galla, G., Mobile Web Apps (2013) IEEE Software, pp. 22-27; Shneiderman, B., Plaisant, C., (2010) Designing The User Interface, , 5th ed., Pearson; Wijaya, K.K., (2015) Tren Pengembangan Aplikasi Mobile 2015, , https://id.techinasia.com/riset-tren-pengembangan-aplikasi-mobile/, (accessed, 18 January 2016

Title: Multi-character string matching algorithm based on state machine
Source title: International Review on Computers and Software
Authors with affiliations: Adinugroho, T.Y., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Soewito, B., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: One way to enhance the string matching process is by processing multiple characters at once. This research purpose is to create a multi-pattern string matching algorithm that is able to process multiple characters at once and can be implemented by software. The proposed algorithm is based on a state machine string matching algorithm. The experiment is done using data geared for Network Intrusion Detection System which use snort rules and some network packet file captured for research purpose. The research results show that the proposed multicharacter string matching algorithm is faster but consume more memory against the tested single character string matching algorithm. © 2016 Praise Worthy Prize S.r.l. - All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Algorithm; Multi pattern string matching; Multi-character string matching; Software
References: Hasib, S., Motwani, M., Saxena, A., Importance of Aho-Corasick String Matching Algorithm in Real World Applications (2013) International Journal of Computer Science and Information Technologies, pp. 467-469; Patel, B., Deterministic Memory-Efficient String Matching Algorithms for Intrusion Detection (2014) International Journal of Computer Engineering and Sciences; Aho, A.V., Corasick, M.J., Efficient string matching: An aid to bibliographic search (1975) Magazine Communications of the ACM, pp. 333-340; Rasool, A., Tiwari, A., Singla, G., Khare, N., “String Matching Methodologies:A Comparative Analysis (2012) (IJCSIT) International Journal of Computer Science and Information Technologies, 3 (2), pp. 3394-3397; Lin, C.-H., Tsai, S.-Y., Liu, C.-H., Chang, S.-C., Shyu, J.-M., Accelerating String Matching Using Multi-threaded Algorithm on GPU (2010) Proc. Title: Review of Multi-platform Mobile Application Development Using WebView: Learning Management System on Mobile Platform
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, School of Computer Science, K H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan-Palmersh, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adinugroho, T.Y., Bina Nusantara University, School of Computer Science, K H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan-Palmersh, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Reina, Bina Nusantara University, School of Computer Science, K H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan-Palmersh, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Gautama, J.B., Bina Nusantara University, School of Computer Science, K H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan-Palmersh, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The advancement of mobile technology and the internet network and their rapid adoption has enabled instant information access without relying on desktop or notebook computers. By using this technology, Learning Management System (LMS) can provide an unimpeded interaction for their users and promote awareness for any information updates. It is crucial to develop mobile application for each major mobile platform to reach most of the LMS user. In this paper, the mobile application development was done by combining native mobile technology and web technology using WebView API. This approach was taken to anticipate the need for creating and maintaining the application on multiple mobile platform and was expected to cut development time frame while retaining consistent interface and still enable platform specific's feature usage. The purpose of this study is to review the strengths and weaknesses of such combination in mobile application development specifically under android platform. © 2015 The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V.
Author Keywords: Learning Management System; Mobile Application Development; Multi-platform; WebView
Index Keywords: Application programming interfaces (API); Artificial intelligence; Mobile computing; Mobile phones; Mobile telecommunication systems; Telecommunication equipment; Android platforms; Information access; Information updates; Learning management system; Mobile application development; Mobile applications; Multi-platform; Webview; Information management

Authors: Yulianto B., Heriyanni E., Dewi L.C., Adinugroho T.Y.
Title: Architecture and Implementation of Instant Messaging in Educational Institution
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Yulianto, B., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Heriyanni, E., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Dewi, L.C., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Adinugroho, T.Y., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Development of communication technology on smartphones can be used to meet the needs of actual mass communication (real time chat), concise, and efficient in educational institutions, especially for students and lecturers. This research aims to produce architectural design and implementation of web and Android based instant messaging (IM) which can be applied to educational institutions as a fast, provident, and effective communication means. This study was conducted by collecting data through questionnaires distributed among the students and the lecturers. The IM application is developed based on Rational Unified Process (RUP) software development method. The architecture and IM application are XMPP protocol based that can be implemented on web and Android platform with personal chat, group chat, broadcast messages, scheduled messages, and file attachments features. The application can facilitate the communication from an educational institution to or between students and lecturers, and gather students and lecturers' phone number and email. © 2015 The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V.
Author Keywords: broadcast message; instant messaging; personal chat; real-time chat; scheduled message; xmpp
Index Keywords: Android (operating system); Application programs; Artificial intelligence; Education; Internet protocols; Message passing; Network architecture; Software design; Surveys; World Wide Web; Broadcast messages; Instant messaging; personal chat; Real time; scheduled message; xmpp; Students
